quotes.quote: Easy street is a blind alley.
The street finds its own uses for things.
The street is full of humiliations to the proud.
The magic of the street is the mingling of the errand and the epiphany.
If you can smell the street by looking at the photo, it's a street photograph.
It sounded as if the streets were running, And then the streets stood still.
On the streets, unrequited love and death go together almost as often as in Shakespeare.
This is Sesame Street. A place where people, birds, monsters all live in perfect harmony.
A dead end can never be a one way street; you can always turn around and take another road.
If a street has a spirit, no matter how narrow it is, we can breathe comfortably over there.
If you’re going down the street and you’re going the wrong way, remember – God permits U-turns.
What is a street? It is where the living weep, where the dead go off in silence to their peace.
A street full of shadows will teach you what life is much better than the street full of lights!
The street is the river of life of the city, the place where we come together, the pathway to the center.
Even the poorest street is rich with people on it and even the richest street is poor without people on it!
When the night comes, streets welcome the lonely souls because they alone can fully understand the lonely streets!
Sometimes a gloomy street is all a sad person needs! A magical relief may arise from the meeting of the two sad things!
The streets have two spirits: One is its own spirit and the other spirit is all the living creatures living in the street!
The street is no place to race.
Silent streets have many things to say.
The streets of hell are paved with good intentions.
Respect is a one way street, it goes from bottom to top.
Standing on a street corner waiting for no one is power.
In the street, the gaze of desire is furtive or menacing.
The roaring street is hung for miles With fierce electric fire.
Every path, every street in the world is your walking meditation path.
Streets moderate the form and structure and comfort of urban communities.
The streets are full of admirable craftsmen, but so few practical dreamers.
At any street corner the feeling of absurdity can strike any man in the face.
When you work at street level you never know who's going to walk through your door.
